website_summaries.verdict: This is the Amazon Echo with a small screen. The screen comes in handy when the answer you want is visual.
pros: The added screen is particularly helpful for viewing photos, using a calendar, or watching a YouTube video
cons: The Echo Show is bigger and in daily use we find that we don't use the monitor very much

website_summaries.verdict: Amazon's touchscreen Alexa device shows potential for people interested in video chatting with friends and family members, but it needs a little more development before we'd recommend it.
pros: The Echo Show offers everything you love about Alexa, complete with new video and touchscreen controls
It shines best as a dedicated, hands-free video calling command center
cons: At launch, the touchscreen visuals don't do enough to bring Alexa to life, or make her much easier to use -- though that could change with the arrival of new screen-specific Alexa skills

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed and so is the rest of my family
customer_reviews.text: YouTube was one of my primary reasons for buying two Echo Shows. Very disappointed and so is the rest of my family. Why would Amazon think an easy solution for a customer would be to use web based services. The ease of use is what sells a product in today's world. I would not recommend buying an Echo Show right now. I'd stick with only buying the Amazon Echo, Tap, and similar voice activated user friendly devices because there is nothing to show on the ECHO SHOW. Basically now my Echo Show is a fancy clock with weather updates sitting on a side table collecting dust.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy the Echo Show
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the Echo Show, had issues with the device Screen, Amazon charged me over $46 for a restocking fee on a non-working device.
customer_reviews.author: LDK

customer_reviews.title: Consumer loss due to corporate pettiness.  .
customer_reviews.text: All the how-to videos. All the recipe videos. All the music videos. All the trending cat videos. All of these are lost because Echo show can't play youtube videos. I would change my review in a heartbeat if they fixed this problem. Until they do, however, it's just unacceptable to have a web connected video device that does not have access to the largest repository of online videos.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No You Tube = No Joy
customer_reviews.text: 5-star Device until Youtube was pulled. 1-Star now. Amazon is being ridiculous here. They will not sell Google Devices on their store and they recently started pulling Nest Devices off. When I shop, I expect a store to provide a full set of options. My grocery stores carry other brands than their own, that is what I expect from Amazon. Start selling Google devices and let your products speak for themself. Don't increase your sales by limited the competition. That is how monopolies are formed and the DOJ comes knocking. Work with Google to get Youtube back and start selling Google products.
customer_reviews.author: Shan A. Greer

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I'm not super impressed with the show, especially for the price. It's no better than having a tablet and a stand. Someone reported the speaker was on par with the original echo, it's not, it is plenty loud though. Given you could create the same basic set-up with a $50 tablet and a $30 bluetooth speaker, I'm going with 3 stars. It's cool for an alarm clock than lets you read news headlines, or plays random documentaries on command, but not $130 cool, much less $220.
customer_reviews.author: Vargr

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase.... screen broken after 2 months... flickering.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this! I’ve had it for 2 months and the screen started flickering and because it was past the one month they would not return it. This is complete fraud in amazons part. This should have a one year manufacturer warranty for a product this expensive. No help from amazon and I will soon be dropping the entire echo line and moving to the google home. Amazon does not back their products.
customer_reviews.author: Sakina Zerdani

customer_reviews.title: Amazon should ask customers to agree to Beta test the device when purchasing
customer_reviews.text: Having used it for a week, I'm returning it. 50-60% of the time, it either does not understand what I've asked it to do, or it does it incorrectly. Besides this, I feel the device is WAY overpriced. The OS feels like a tablet from the early 2000's. The real nail in the coffin was that after syncing the device with my phone, the alexa app doesn't have my most of my contacts detected with no explanation or help readily available. I have neither the time nor the desire to beta test this device for Amazon anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Helps paralyzed communicate
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend is paralyzed and is able to now call and communicate with me for the first time via the Echo Show since accident by himself. I can drop in and speak with him anytime.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Echo Show
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! Set up took me about 1.5 minutes. Just plug it in choose your wifi and input your pw thats it. A huge step up in the echo lineup. Folks at this price jump on it now, You won't be sorry. I use timers,reminders, wake up alarm, recipes, Wikipedia, music, smart bulbs and plugs and the list goes on and on and on etc. Great sounding speakers, great screen size too. I'd give it ten stars if I could. Have a nice day:)
customer_reviews.author: Z.T.B.

customer_reviews.title: Overall I love the concept and features of this product
customer_reviews.text: Overall I love the concept and features of this product, but have to give it one star because it doesn’t have a basic EQ built in. Everything sounds muffled and somewhat unintelligible, some content worse than others. Alexa herself I sometimes struggle to understand. No music yet sounds bright and clear. I bought two units and both behave the same. I see online that it used to have a “hidden” EQ but was told by tech support that this was removed!! Please put it back so I can enjoy this product without struggling to hear audio
customer_reviews.author: Dennis T.

customer_reviews.title: Needs some work
customer_reviews.text: This is our third echo product to buy, we love the echo, we have the original one, and the 2nd gen Echo Dot, but we have had some issues with the Echo Show. There is a huge lag when we ask Alexa to do anything...setting a timer really causes and issue because it doesn't start immediately. The Show also has frozen multiple times and there is no way to exit and return to the main screen, we just have to wait it out. It has great potential and we love the idea of it, but it has a few kinks that need to be worked out for us to be fully satisfied with purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: WAIT FOR 2ND GENERATION - LOTS OF BUGS, SLOW, POOR SPEECH RECOGNITION AND ACCURACY COMPARED TO OTHER ECHOS
customer_reviews.text: Bought two and sent them both back. I have used the Echo and Echo Dot. Compared to those, this unit is MUCH SLOWER and does not pick up voice recognition as well. The video feature needs a lot of perfecting. Not many of the "SKILLS" are applicable. Came across several bugs, like accuracy, speed, freezing screens, and horrible video touch screen interface. Save your money and wait for the second generation to come out. This one stinks.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: YouTube is a Bust Now
customer_reviews.text: Amazon and Google need to get over whatever their issue is. The two things I used this product for was for controlling smart features, and watching YouTube videos. Well now that I can't watch videos any more, this thing is a $230 echo dot with a screen that shows me stupid clickbait headlines. Fix this issue or this thing will be a $230 doorstop.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Larrea

customer_reviews.title: Beware of random, unsolicited commercials when the device is not in use!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased about 6 months ago. While we originally would have given this device 4 stars (it does not connect with our Arlo cameras, as promised, most of the time we attempt) our opinion changed this evening. All was quiet in our house as we were getting ready for bed. Randomly Alexa starts some sort of video music, which turns out to be a commercial for Esquire. We were not in YouTube, etc. The device was quiet and not in use!! Amazon if you continue to play random, unsolicited commercials you will render this equipment useless and it will go straight to the trash can.
customer_reviews.author: Jmr

customer_reviews.title: It is nice, works well to adjust my thermostats in the ...
customer_reviews.text: It is nice, works well to adjust my thermostats in the house. I keep it in the kitchen. It would be really nice if / when they come out with a cordless version that does not need to be plugged in. It would be handy to move it around some. But then can plug it in to charge it. If you have it on the table, but want to move it to the counter to follow a recipe, would be handy just to unplug it and move it and not lose connection.
customer_reviews.author: David Bach

customer_reviews.title: Product work excellent first day but during first night in darkness
customer_reviews.text: Product work excellent first day but during first night in darkness, display dimmed to where only the time and rotating messages are visible in anything but total darkness. Playing any videos, even in darkness, it's impossible to see. There is no brightness control nor any command that I can find to brighten the display. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea but spotty performance
customer_reviews.text: The concept is good. But the performance is a little spotty. I am using the Echo Show for an elderly person and I am using an iPhone and my success rate is about 50%. Did find out that it performs better on a WiFi versus using my phone provider. I am hoping the performance improves.
customer_reviews.author: Robin G Martin

customer_reviews.title: No YouTube
customer_reviews.text: No YouTube!!! It has dropped YouTube. The only thing it had over the other Amazon devices.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for elderly - great way to check on family members
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 87 year old mother, couldn’t be more pleased with it! I registered it to my amazon acct and placed it at her assisted living hooked up to their wi-fi. She doesn’t need a phone or amazon acct to use it. It’s so easy she was using it within minutes, and it was super easy to enable drop in for my sisters. They just downloaded the Alexa app on their phones and I enabled their access. Now they can “drop in” on her any time! My mom has already figured out how to make a call! She loves seeing us everyday, she could never figure out an iPhone of FaceTime or Skype but she can use this.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Cannot be used as a baby monitor!
customer_reviews.text: I am very frustrated with this purchase. I bought it so that I could use it as a baby monitor with my Canary cameras. (As advertised by both Alexa and Canary. However, the live stream only stays on the device for a limited time. After that, it times out and goes back to the Alexa home screen. So, it does not function as a baby monitor. In fact, that could have been very dangerous if I had fallen asleep without realizing it had timed out. Completely unacceptable!
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Reed

customer_reviews.title: NO YOUTUBE ON ALEXA
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Plugged it in no issues there went off without a hitch, asked ALEXA to YouTube a video. NO YOU TUBE. Kept checking and trying finally "Googled" it. Guess what no YouTube because Amazon wont sell there Google's home product or chrome cast either. So google who owns YT removed it off all amazon products. I am sending them back. What's the point.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Camera angle is not that wide and the upward angle ...
customer_reviews.text: Camera angle is not that wide and the upward angle of the camera is not ideal. Don't get it thinking you will be able to check in on your home for security reasons because the camera view is limited and not ideal.
customer_reviews.author: bkg2929

customer_reviews.title: It was great at first but with continued use you realize how ...
customer_reviews.text: It was great at first but with continued use you realize how much this product is lacking. It's not a very intuitive product and has only set predefined commands it can listen to and access. Aside from those commands, it's clueless as to what to do. The skills are there but very flawed. For example the CNN app, can't select the video you ask it. It'll keep playing older videos in a loop so if you ask it to play video 1, it'll play a random video in the list. Other skills are the same. Still needs a lot of work for Alexa to be worth 230 dollars!!!! But it's great for setting timers and making a shopping list.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing use of display, mediocre sound
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from an Echo Dot, hoping for great sound and expecting the display to be useful. Instead, the sound can be best described as "cheap", and the display is annoying. The first thing I searched for was how to turn off the "Try" messages; you can't. The next thing I searched for was how to turn off the whole display. I am just shocked to see such a worthless touchscreen in a world drowning in brilliant smart phones and tablets. And, oh, by the way, my Google Home is simply better at answering questions. It can call local businesses without me having to add them to my contact list.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Loyd

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I love it and am trying to convince my mother to get one ! She just got the fire tv with voice control so we’re getting there🙄. It was well packaged, perfect condition, beautiful screen, high quality/loud speakers, great voice call and FaceTime! I also use it as a security camera in our bedroom which is where my 3 legged Yorkie likes to be.

With access to our parent account purchasing abilities, videos, and other miscellaneous information, this devices is unusable for us. Another big downside is that we can't have all of the devices playing the same music simultaneously like Sonos speakers.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Respons Most of the Time

customer_reviews.title: I feel like I wasted my money

SHAME ON YOU AMAZON FOR SELLING CRAP!!

customer_reviews.title: I bought I would like the large color screen but it's always so dark ...

customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Echo show = Huge hit for the household
customer_reviews.text: I replaced one of my standard echos with this. It blows the others away. Graphics, videos, the sound. It is a huge hit in the house. We keep it in the kitchen. My wife calls up recipes on it. They appear on the screen to use while cooking. There are also tons of food network videos as well. It shows the news and sports in video fashion. Super easy set up.
customer_reviews.author: Ian F

customer_reviews.title: No YouTube support because Google and Amazon have a disagreement
customer_reviews.text: Everything is awesome down to the speakers... Except for no YouTube support because Google and Amazon have a disagreement. This was half the reason why I bought this product so it's a bit of a turndown... Really hoping they can resolve it in the future, but for now, you should just know that you won't be able to use YouTube if you purchase this. I don't plan to return it just because it still supports Spotify and the hardware is very decent for the price I got it at. Love the speakers. But buying an alarm clock/music player was not my plan. PLEASE WORK TO RESOLVE DISAGREEMENTS WITH GOOGLE AND SUPPORT YOUTUBE AGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: Cool fun technology
customer_reviews.text: wow, this is really neat. I had pre-ordered this before I bought my Echo Dot. Only had the Dot a few weeks before receiving my Echo Show. This is technology that's fun to use. I like it better every day. I'm looking forward to friends getting an Echo Show so we can video chat and "drop In".
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Subpar 7" screen & no real worthy content to watch on it without YouTube.
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea but no YouTube. Really??? Without it the screen feature is pretty much useless even with Prime movies or videos available. Who wants watch full movie on the 7" screen. And the LCD screen could've been better quality it off axis viewing is horrible and resolution for 2018 is subpar at that. Might as well just have a Echo classic. I guess it's only saving grace is video calling and drop in feature for my 82 year old mom that isn't too tech savvy. But, honestly at a minimum settle your squable with Google and bring back YouTube capabilities at least.
customer_reviews.author: Brian K. Beresford

customer_reviews.title: I was very excited that amazon introduced this product as ...

The issue is that the device began to have video distortion within 14 days of purchase. concerned about device quality a bit
customer_reviews.author: David "HT" Kramer

customer_reviews.title: I'm somewhat disappointed. It is so limited in it's features
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I spent $229 on this thing! . It is so limited in it's features. I was hoping that it would support YouTube or even Netflix.The speakers however are wonderful as compared to even the Echo, which I think are pretty good. So it's great for the music but so far that's all I don't have any use for the drop in feature as I don't know anyone else who even has this thing.. I think prefer any tablet to this. I so hope there will be updates and in time they will add Netflix, YouTube, and music videos. Any chance of that?

customer_reviews.title: YouTube is no longer an option!!!
customer_reviews.text: You can no longer watch YouTube videos!!! What the heck!!?? That's why I bought this!!! I want my money back, I'm very upset!!

customer_reviews.title: Limited usefulness to consumers.  Lots of data for Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: Really fairly useless. Gives limited information that you can get just as well from your phone. Do you really need another electronic device that provides (and captures your) data? I got one, set it up (easy to get going, clumsy to make useful), and then didn't use it. No one in my house used it including my teenage daughters. In fact, they often unplug the device because it's just too Orwellian for them. Forgot to return it during the return period. Will be going up on eBay.
customer_reviews.author: wlshirer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Already owned the dot wanted to get the echo show to video message family when away. So far works well. Yes all parties need an Amazon account, speakers are better then the dot and having the touch screen is great. Video quality is great and once you set up the accounts it is easy to video call. All in all a great product so far. Happy with purchase. Pro: ease of use, video call is great, images and video flash great. Con: need some more skills would love to be able to play youtube clips
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Lack of Apps and Youtube make this purchase unjustifiable.
customer_reviews.text: Without support for Youtube, unable to use apps from the app store, no dedicated browser, and searching the web limited to voice commands only, I was very unimpressed with the available options on the echo show. With that being said, the design was pleasing to look at and the UI was clean and simple to use. I returned my anemic show and plan to get a Fire 10 tablet with a stand and bluetooth speaker as what I believe will be a far superior experience. While the microphone on the 10 may not be as good as the show, I am sure the other features and better display will make up for it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew David Smothers

customer_reviews.title: Get it, and you will buy another.
customer_reviews.text: We love our echo...as a tech guru... I was not going to buy the voice activated tech until it got really good. But my wife bought me one for my birthday and I absolutely couldn't live without it I love it. I like the fact that I can ask for music and get it and my kids can watch their movies that we have on Prime Amazon's a genius for connecting all of its products with this device seamlessly.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Must have specific providers to use this
customer_reviews.text: You MUST have Fios, Frontier, DISH, Fire TV to use video capability. You cannot watch videos at all unless you have these. I tried to watch BBC news but even with it added it would not play. No Youtube either. This is pretty useless unless you have those. Also not as intuitive as my first echo this one seems dumb as more often than not it does not know answer.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: The screen went out after two months
customer_reviews.text: Conceptually I really liked the idea of the show but there are issues. It doesn't play YouTube for one which was widely acknowledged. My biggest issue though is two months after buying it the screen has begun flickering and now I really cant watch anything. Overall I'm really disappointed and regret buying it. Look at the black lines at the bottom of the screen. The longer you watch it the higher they go.

customer_reviews.title: Alexa does it all!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! It has a constant time and temperature reading. It constantly gives you ideas to ask Alexa. She’s easy to read. Easy to talk to, and she wakes me up at 5:40am to music from the 80’s. I still haven’t used all of her abilities but I’ m looking forward to learning more. She is awesome and worth every dollar.
customer_reviews.author: Kitkat

customer_reviews.title: RED ALERT - YOUTUBE NO LONGER AVAILABLE ON SHOW
customer_reviews.text: RED ALERT -- YOUTUBE NO LONGER AVAILABLE ON THE SHOW...this is my first Amazon review....The loss of YouTube is a Deal Breaker....It doesn't seem that this is going to get resolved......as others have said...it's very "useless" with out YouTube...too bad...Had so much potential!
customer_reviews.author: Robt B. Porter

customer_reviews.title: This is a miracle machine
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised that you could do so many things. It is a lifesaver between my sister and I. We can visually see each other. She is in a nursing home and I am handicapped at home. My sister is very intelligent and because she is bedridden she lost interest in alot of things she loved to do. This has opened up new doors for her. She just loves it. She can play most of the music she loves, play games, learns from questions she asks. It is like a good friend to her. I also get to be there visually for her care conference. Thank you so much for inventing such a wonderful machine.
customer_reviews.author: penny dagen

customer_reviews.title: Was great, but now...
customer_reviews.text: • No longer works with YouTube, which is how I previously used it much of the time. • The screen on mine started flickering badly, and getting it replaced under warranty was a major headache. I think a new Amazon Fire tablet that supports hands-free Alexa might be a much better option than the Echo Show.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Burke

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful large screen!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Show! It displays my Prime photos of the day beautifully, tells me the weather, displays my shopping list, controls my lights, and answers a zillion questions! The screen will turn off completely when I want to sleep. Alexa doesn’t always understand what I’m saying, but gets it right about 90%. Turning off the lights is a little worse, maybe 70% of the time she gets it done on the first try, so I do have to repeat myself a bit. But overall the beautiful large screen makes up for it. The customer service is excellent too; my Show stopped turning off the screen to sleep one night, and the problem was fixed by the next night!
customer_reviews.author: joyflute

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE our Echo Show! The sound is fabulous and the family loves the lyrics when music is played. It is a tablet, a calendar, and everything Alexa should be. And if you set up your preferences properly you won't have any issues with her listening or calling contacts mistakenly. It is all in the set up.

customer_reviews.title: I don't use it much because I can't get it to do anything.
customer_reviews.text: When I am talking to it - I'm usually telling it to stop doing what it's doing. Do I want the news when I'm trying to go to bed - nope. That's probably what I tell it to do most is turn the screen off as it's too bright. Most things I ask it to do I get back "Hmmm, I don't know that one." I guess I need to learn how to use it but I don't really have a use for it like I thought I would. "Alexa, can you send music using wifi?" "Sorry, I don't know that one." Seems like an easy question.
customer_reviews.author: Operational Necessity

customer_reviews.text: Well 60 days later from my review.. I worked with the technican, updated software.. problem came back.. I shipped it out the service department said they updated the software.. It worked well and now GUESS WHAT!!!!! The screen is jumping all over the place.. This is the first worse purchase I've made with Amazon. Everything I've purchased has worked well or it was returned and now I have this Echo Show that's really driving me insane... If it was an option I believe at this point I would opt out for a refund.. Did I say I was disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: Patrica D Scott

customer_reviews.title: One Major Flaw
customer_reviews.text: **UPDATE** Rachel (From Amazon) did get this to work, but I have to use my daughter's cell phone to register my Mom's Echo Show. Which makes it awkward when your Mom wants to call you and has to say, "Alexa, call Daddy" LOL While I'm writing this, I'm on the phone with Amazon customer service, trying to get Echo Show to work for my 86-year old mother. Apparently, if you don't own a smartphone (which many elderly people do not), you're kinda screwed. This is truly a flaw that seems pretty basic, and excludes a huge portion of Amazon's potential customer base. Hopefully, this will be changed, soon.
customer_reviews.author: M Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I really did want to love it. Maybe it’s the warranty.
customer_reviews.text: I love the echo. I have 7 devices in 4 rooms! I’ve bought echos as gifts for friends, and although I was never enamored by the echo shows bulkiness, I bought 2 of them anyway. 1 device had issues from the start. Bad screen -after several calls, amazon agrees to take it back. They don’t see the problem and send it back. Problem occurs again and they swap it for new refurbished model. Replacement shuts down every 2 days and now another replacement. I’d stay away from this model, clearly it needs some imrpovements,
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: We really like the Shopping List feature as well as other lists
customer_reviews.text: We really like the Shopping List feature as well as other lists. However, the reason we don't "love it" is because many times when we request information of Alexa, including ones that are recommended in followup emails we have received, Alexa comes back with comments like "I don't know that," or "I'm not sure of that" or some other escape phrase. When we rephrase the question, thinking perhaps we were misunderstood, Alexa repeats one of the phrases or comes up with another escape phrase. That is terribly annoying!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon D.

customer_reviews.title: 1 year limited warranty for a reason
customer_reviews.text: Less than 2 years old and the sound stutters and stops intermittently. Customer service had me go through the usual resets etc and after 2 hours of back and forth, the resolution was for me to buy a new unit with a 15% discount. They then offered 25% discount. Disappointed in Amazon for not standing behind one of their own products.
customer_reviews.author: CAZ

customer_reviews.title: Great fun. Only one thing I dont like
customer_reviews.text: I love my Alexa. My schedule comes up on her everyday. She knows the weather, can play my music, audio books, and games. The only thing is that she is not like a google device. You won't get answers to your questions unless you program a skill in her. Programing skills are easy but if you wlask a question about that skill you have to ask alexa to ask "that skill" and then your question. Other than that I think she is great. She also raps, sings, tells jokes, riddles, and will answer personal questions about her self.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie G

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I was apprehensive to pull the purchase trigger on the Echo Show given the wide range of reviews... until the price dropped to $149. Especially at this price point, the Show is a great addition to my Alexa family. I have no issues with the Show hearing and understanding me like many of the 1 star reviews. The sound quality is very good and the screen is crisp and vibrant.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fry

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected results in our home.  We were skeptical. It is great.
customer_reviews.text: MY significant other is 100% deaf, so the SHOW ME features of text on screen, capioning on videos, the weather report both audio and print makes this an amazingly wonderful product to have in our kitchen . He is not left out because of the SHOW ME screen - and I love being able to watch cooking videos and ask for any music play list imaginable. The songs even have the lyrics on screen. I am so impressed. If you say -- ALEXA - Take my picture -- it does. And, then it stores them and shows them to you if you say -- Alexa, show me my pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Pemberton

customer_reviews.title: Understand the camera before purchasing
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth Echo. What I didn’t realize is it’s camera cannot be turned off unless you go onto DND mode in which case it’s pretty useless. Cannot put tape over the camera either, or it thinks you are no longer there and again stops working. It’s a bit creepy considering all it is used for (in my case) is to wake up the screen. Amazon’s going to have a lot of nude photos of me—glad I’m not modest😉
customer_reviews.author: ChihuahuaMan

customer_reviews.title: Bad Echo Show - Flickers - Flashes Terrible
customer_reviews.text: This unit is a little over a month old...screen flickers, flashes. I have restarted, reset, up-plugged...nothing stops it. Come to find out the are many put there like hours. Please send us one that works or refund our money now!
customer_reviews.author: M MacLane

customer_reviews.title: New review - great prodyct
customer_reviews.text: Now that YouTube has been restored to the Show, it is back to being a much used device. The YouTube access is still a little difficult, A!was defaults to Amazon's music and videos and won't willingly search YouTube but you can force it. When I first got it, it was great! Used it in the kitchen watching instructional videos of what I was preparing. Without YouTube, I don't use it except as a timer. What a waste. A Dot would work the same.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald L. Babb

customer_reviews.title: Short lived garbage
customer_reviews.text: They've stopped making this, but after only slightly over a year, and just out of warranty, this unit is failing. Keeps locking up, screen goes to show the time only, and it keeps shutting off the wifi by itself. I have to unplug it and plug it back in on a regular basis. It will only play videos part way, then lock up. The voice recognition is failing too. This wasn't a cheap item and I would expect more from something that Amazon brands as their own.
customer_reviews.author: paracelsus

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE A SMARTPHONE TO USE CALLING FEATURE
customer_reviews.text: This may be a good product for some, but there is very important information MISSING in the product description. I purchased this for my elderly parents so that I can converse with them via the Drop In video calling feature. What Amazon does not tell you is the owner of the devise MUST HAVE A SMARTPHONE. My 86 and 91 yr old parents do not have smart phones. They struggle with understanding their old style flip phones. Without being able to import contacts from an Alexa App on a smart phone, I can not set up the calling feature which was the whole purpose for purchasing. This will be returned if I can not find a work around. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: but I LOVE my e
customer_reviews.text: I’m still learning new tricks everyday, but I LOVE my e. show. Sound is great. Being able to actually see another person is great. I know there is Skype and other links, but this is more like using a real/regular phone. Of course no one past 30 will know what I’m talking about, but there are many old geeks like me that will. Actually, baby boomers are the majority nowadays, aren’t they..?? Yup..!! Lots of people will get what am I talking about. Lol Thanks Amazon. Keep up the GREAT work. 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: Can't emphasize strongly enough how this has taken a lot of worry away from the family.
customer_reviews.text: Older mother who lives alone and has fallen several times. We put three of these on the different levels of the house and she can call for help anywhere now. NOT 911, though. The drop in feature is awesome because she can't work skype. Now she can just reach out anytime, and we can easily check on her as well. She doesn't have to try to run up or down a flight of stairs when we call. It's also great to keep in contact when she is upstairs and we are down.
customer_reviews.author: Rsiedy

customer_reviews.title: No YouTube
customer_reviews.text: I rec'd this for Christmas and was very excited to get it. I thought this would be an improvement over my google home. I was so disappointed that it no longer views YouTube. Hopefully something can be worked out to get that back. It doesn't answer questions as well as google and not having the YouTube capability anymore only earns it a two star and I never give low ratings but just really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: iagolfer

customer_reviews.title: They work like they are supposed to!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd "used" Echo Show 1st Generation that I've purchased. If you are like me and don't have to have the most recent generation, these are a steal. I'm equipping most of my family around the country with these so we can video chat using these devices. Of course you get all the other "perks" from Alexa as well. Both of these came packaged like a new one and had I not known they were "used" there would have been no way to tell...they look brand new. But, because they are "used", the price allows these to be bought for all your friends and family!
customer_reviews.author: J. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Like giving Mainstream Media Fake-News its own special spot on your Countertop
customer_reviews.text: I agree with the content of most of the other 1-star reviews about not being able to control or manage what is displayed on the screen, but I will add the additional nuisance of the programming that does cross the screen being very politically polarized and left-leaning. I supposed before owning this device, I would not have associated Amazon with Google, Twitter and Facebook in their quest to promote the CNN-NBC style "fake news" view of the world. I find it pretty disturbing that even our automated assistant now has to become a tool to advance the leftist social engineering, mind-shaping agenda that so many people aren't aware they are controlled by.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: I am enjoying my new Echo Show and am constantly ...
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying my new Echo Show and am constantly thinking of new things to try. I only wish I had purchased two for $100.00 more.
customer_reviews.author: Frances M. Baynard

customer_reviews.title: I’m in love!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little concerned after reading some reviews but the show just arrived and I loooove it! I have had the echo since before it came out (I was one of the trials) and my husband just dropped it so I decided to try the show. It’s my new kitchen companion!! It gets really loud and I can watch videos on Vimeo, or songs with lyrics. It also reads you books.
customer_reviews.author: Renata

customer_reviews.title: Cant' answer simple questions
customer_reviews.text: Could not answer most of my questions. I have nothing for it to control so it's a waste of time and money. It couldn't even tell me the grades of beef or cuts of beef. Couldn't give the basketball rankings, etc. Needs help on it's ability to answer questions. Every time it failed, my phone could give me an answer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trending Topics are USELESS
customer_reviews.text: I like the Echo Show except for one feature - the home screen trending topics. Amazon daily shows trending topics that it thinks is important and much of it is junk. I am currently watching news regarding mangos, a girl setting the record for 4 leaf clover hunting, a birthday roundup for the day, and news about a walking dead mobile app. All stuff I don't care about. Come on Amazon, let us configure the trending topics so I get news that makes a difference to me, whether it be financial, sports, tech related, politics, or stuff that each of us individually cares about. The constant stream of useless information really makes the "idle" mode almost useless.
customer_reviews.author: jkAddison

customer_reviews.title: I liked the scrolling news/stories/videos feature and love that I can ...
customer_reviews.text: We have a lot of Alexa/Echo in our home and I just had to have the Show too. I have her in my kitchen and she is a lot of help. I liked the scrolling news/stories/videos feature and love that I can get her to show me You Tube while I'm cooking. I also love the ease of "Echo set me a 10 minute timer" when I'm cooking multiple items and need a timer without me stopping to set the one of the oven. I love the style and she fits in perfectly with my white and grey kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Tate

customer_reviews.title: $725.00 and we can't get Alexa to turn the lights white.
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 of these devices in our home (echo show, Echo 2nd gen, Dot, Plus) and 19 "smart lights" since December 2017, That's a LOT of $ we've spent on for something that's stressed our lives out. We are so over it, we can't even get the blasted lights to turn white using Alexa/Echo! This thing is the most stressful thing I have ever wasted my money on, the last thing we need in the morning is to fight with Alexa with green, blue or red or any other color except WHITE while trying to get ready for work. Only thing good about these speakers is the sound quality and Amazon Music,
customer_reviews.author: Nekosdad

customer_reviews.title: Failing just like my friends...
customer_reviews.text: Out of warranty and just like my friends the audio is jittery/skippy bad sounding. At times it will just stop playing all together. Pulling the plug will help for a little bit, but slowly returns over the course of a day or a few hours. Alexa can't answer even answer or complete some of the most simple tasks, its confusing how many times it makes me just shake my head. Makes me want to change to the Google equivilant
customer_reviews.author: Nick in MN

customer_reviews.title: Alexa is good but still has some bugs
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect it to be so thick but also I was expecting the screen to be a little larger than it was but overall a pretty decent product. Sometimes Alexa has issues listening and there are somethings that Alexa says to do this and then you ask her she doesn't seem to get it on the first time or sometimes at all. Asking Alexa to open amazon movies or amazon music are not commands that Alexa seems to act on. Still need to check out the video conferencing/calling function yet. I like the tap into other Alexa products and then home automation you can do with it.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Wise

customer_reviews.title: Can't get to YouTube Videos which is a huge waste of the screen.
customer_reviews.text: Alexa is brilliant and having a screen attached to it is awesome. Amazon Music shows the lyrics when you play songs. HUGE DOWNSIDE THOUGH... Apparently Amazon is fighting with Google so you can't get to YouTube Videos which is a severe disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Kinetech Solutions

customer_reviews.title: Good, not yet great.
customer_reviews.text: The Echo Show is definitely a natural progression for the Echo/Alexa ecosystem. As with any new product, there are things to like and not like. Pros: -You can watch Amazon Prime and Youtube videos on this device. -Sound is decent. -Video calling with other Echo Shows or the Alexa smartphone app is good. Cons: -No parental controls on viewing Amazon Prime videos. Need either controls to lock out viewing during certain times and/or a passcode to unlock that feature. -Takes several seconds for the built-in cameras to focus when calling other Echo Shows. -When viewing third-party cameras like the Arlo cameras, there is no way to have a 2-way audio conversation.
customer_reviews.author: JWin

customer_reviews.title: Great - with one glaring flaw
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome overall. However - buyer beware. If you do not own a smart phone (and anyone you gift this to does not own a smart phone) you CAN NOT set up video calling. To me, this is absurd. Why doe I need a smart phone to make this connect to another Show device? I went around and around with tech support on this. In the end, it had many features that are fantastic - but those of us who refuse to become smart phone zombies are SOL.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Galamaga

customer_reviews.title: Was not ready for release
customer_reviews.text: I think this should have gone through a lot more development before release. I feel I speak clearly, Alexa has serious problems understanding my requests and since it is not a tabllet with apps, voice communication is the only way to access it. Still no Netflix. If you pause during a movie or YouTube it goes back to home screen after a very short period of time and when I request resume it says it does not have that function. Picture quality and sound are good. I am just disappointed with its usefulness.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Sherriff

customer_reviews.title: Wavy Horizontal Lines Across My Screen Will Not Go Away!!
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed that the replacement warranty ended for my Echo Show just 6 months ago. I started having horizontal wavy lines show up on the bottom of my screen about 4 months ago, pretty much when we started using it more every day and now it covers the ENTIRE screen continuously. I have purchased so much from Amazon and have never had any serious issues but this was a very expensive item that I feel should have had a longer window considering the many complaints about this very same problem. Mine just happened to start AFTER the replacement warrant ended. I only wanted it replaced, not a refund. Please help Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Coda99

customer_reviews.title: The Show is a Go!!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Show! It works as well for me as my Echo Dots. I do have a loud voice so I may not be the best reviewer for this product. Love the display and the news stories it rolls across, even the quirky ones. My only complaint is the sound from the Show is more directly in front versus the omnidirectional sound of both the Dot and original Echo. Seems to "understand me" at the same rate other Echo devices do and the "show front door camera" has been a true AHHHH surprise use of this device that just amazes me. I own two and will get the next generation in the hopes of better speakers next version.
customer_reviews.author: B Lee Thomasson Jr

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed that one of the main reasons I purchased this ...
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed that one of the main reasons I purchased this device, and replaced my original Echo, was shut off. I loved the idea of being able to pull up videos from YouTube on the device for my daughter and now that is gone. That and the lack of being able to shop on Amazon's site via the screen makes paying the now $100 more than the Echo a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Elert

customer_reviews.title: Not at all as functional as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Big swing and miss here. Amazon did not at all take advantage of having a touch screen. Instead of being able to browse the echo's capability with the screen, you have to figure it all out with voice commands that are often misinterpreted or misunderstood. Why can't I browse the Amazon video catalog? Why do I have to ask for specific content like "movies in X genre"? Why isn't there an app I can select on the screen? The capability I'd there Amazon just decided to lock all useful functionality behind the voice commands. Regret my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D.

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I bought a Ring Doorbell & Blink camera and wanted the video feed on the screen. A little disappointed because I thought that the screen would automatically show video once the motion sensor on my doorbell was activated but it doesn’t; it does however notify you of motion detected which is better than nothing. Voice recognition is Amazing! I have called out to Alexa from upstairs & over the sounds from the TV and my voice commands has been received; much better that the echo speaker! Still haven’t gone through all the features but overall a great product. Hopefully with some Alexa updates I’ll get that auto video feed I’m looking for but far from disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Cali

customer_reviews.title: Shared Prime Accounts
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest thing since slice bread! One major issue. If you have a household Prime account that you share with you parents or other family members, all Echo Show devices will show all calendars and shopping list. I have spoken to Echo support on a few occasions and this is currently how it works. I really don't want my daughter's calendar coming up on my device and not a fan of her seeing my calendar and shopping list. Their solution is to get my own prime account for $100.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why the need for a smart phone and an application on the smartphone?
customer_reviews.text: the hardware is excellent but the setup leaves a lot to be desired. Why have a cell phone application tied to this product? I purchased so my mother could video the family but found this more difficult to set up simply for her and I have yet to find the setup that would allow my brother to share the video. I would really love this device if setup were clear and flexible.... something that could and should be done without the necessity of a smart phone.
customer_reviews.author: M.E.

customer_reviews.title: Love being able to drop in on Grandma
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the show with the intention of being able to video chat with my 84 year old grandmother. It took some effort to set up an amazon account for her and go through the set up for Alexa Calling (since she does not have a cellphone) but the effort was well worth it. She has no idea how this thing works, or where it came from, but she is always thrilled to see my face on the screen. I chat with her using the Alexa app on my phone every day after work. I have since bought three more of these things to connect the rest of my family.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: See it after you say it
customer_reviews.text: While the product itself is awesome and can control smart home things. Via blue tooth, you can use your phone to make calls, but only to others with an Echo of some sort. It can't open a web browser per se. It can only search for stuff. Also, I'm not able to connect to my Prime Music. It wants me to join another Amazon Music service. It does play videos also from Prime. Maybe I still haven't figured it all out? If you're a liberal, you'll love it. All the apps, etc are all left leaning. Have to search for conservative sites.
customer_reviews.author: Stryker

customer_reviews.title: They're on top of it they seem to care
customer_reviews.text: Just received a phone call from a tech support Personnel about my review. I know now how to overcome the obstacle. I am very happy with the technical support the guy was super cool. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Harris

customer_reviews.title: Loving it
customer_reviews.text: I got my ES 2 weeks ago. It is bigger and heavier than other Echoes, and a little big for your bedroom table, but still it is there. It is pretty esay to configurate, took me less than five minutes . The sound is actually pretty good, nice quality speakers.It has few videos you can actually watch, and it is small to watch a movie, but good for quick news. The calendar is good, also the weather report. Has no aux output like the previus ones, only bt conection.
customer_reviews.author: Surgeonhawkeye

customer_reviews.title: it cannot open the software appropriate like any other android devices
customer_reviews.text: it did not really fulfill much of my expectations, maybe because I am using it in the Philippines, however, all voice commands i instruct the device takes me to a whole new different app, even as simple as asking to open music playlists or music library, it cannot open the software appropriate like any other android devices, its the device has a good concept, but it will take a long time before they can actually reach perfection and fulfill/operate all the features it advertises efficiently, good thing i only bought one piece to try it out
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: I am sure with time they will add some new skills and features this thing will be amazing. Let me say the drop in feature is ...
customer_reviews.text: It's not there yet but, I am sure with time they will add some new skills and features this thing will be amazing. Let me say the drop in feature is awesome! My husband can call while at work I can answer without having to search all over for my phone. We also bought 2 so I can drop in on upstairs or down without screaming up the stairs to each other.
customer_reviews.author: M. ggranville

customer_reviews.title: Glitchy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in Jul 2018. It's now Feb 2020 and this thing glitches constantly. The screen will freeze or Alexa won't respond. Drops wifi signal randomly. I spend more time hard resetting it than actually using it. When it plays music it's sounds like a scratched CD. I would expect something like this to last longer than 2 years. I absolutely would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: AMT

product_meta.title: Echo Show - 1st Generation Black
feature_bullets: Echo Show brings you everything you love about Alexa, and now she can show you things. Watch video flash briefings, Amazon Video content, see music lyrics, security cameras, photos, weather forecasts, to-do and shopping lists, browse and listen to Audible audiobooks, and more. All hands-free—just ask.
Call almost anyone hands-free, or make video calls to family and friends with an Echo Spot, Echo Show, or the Alexa App. Instantly connect to other Echo devices around your home.
See lyrics on-screen with Amazon Music. Just ask to play a song, artist or genre, and stream over Wi-Fi. Also, stream music on Pandora, Spotify, TuneIn, iHeartRadio, and more.

Powerful, room-filling speakers with Dolby processing for crisp vocals and extended bass response. Play your music simultaneously across Echo devices with multi-room music (Bluetooth not supported). Adjust the treble, mid, and bass levels with your voice.

Ask Alexa to show you the front door or monitor the baby's room with compatible cameras from Amazon and others. Turn on lights or the TV, set thermostats, control Amazon Video on Fire TV, and more with WeMo, Philips Hue, Sony, ecobee, and other compatible smart home devices.
With eight microphones, beamforming technology, and noise cancellation, Echo Show hears you from any direction—even while music is playing
Always getting smarter and adding new features, plus thousands of skills like Uber, Allrecipes, CNN, and more
